meanings.definition: Pertaining to or consisting of minutes or small details.
meanings.sent1: The minutial drawings on the tiny stamp were exquisite.
meanings.sent2: She had a keen eye for minutial differences in the artwork.
meanings.sent3: The detective's focus on minutial clues led to solving the case.
meanings.sent4: Her mind worked like a minutial clock, never missing a beat.
meanings.sent5: The minutial stitching on the dress added a touch of elegance.

meanings.definition: Occurring every minute or very frequently.
meanings.sent1: The minutial announcements over the intercom became annoying.
meanings.sent2: The minutial beeping of the alarm clock woke her up every morning.
meanings.sent3: The minutial interruptions during the meeting made it hard to focus.
meanings.sent4: His heart beat at a minutial pace during the intense race.
meanings.sent5: The minutial chirping of the birds outside was a pleasant background noise.
